indications_original: AVAPRO is an angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB) indicated for: Treatment of hypertension, to lower blood pressure. Lowering blood pressure reduces the risk of fatal and nonfatal cardiovascular events, primarily strokes and myocardial infarctions. ( 1.1 ) Treatment of diabetic nephropathy in hypertensive patients with type 2 diabetes, an elevated serum creatinine, and proteinuria. ( 1.2 )
contraindications_original: Indication Dose Hypertension ( 2.2 ) 150 to 300 mg once daily Diabetic Nephropathy ( 2.3 ) 300 mg once daily
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
AVAPRO (irbesartan) is available as white to off-white, biconvex oval, film-coated tablets, debossed with a heart shape on one side and a code on the other (see Table below). Unit-of-use bottles contain 30 or 90 film-coated tablets as follows: 
                  
                     
                     
                     
                     
                     
                        
                           
                           75 mg
                           150 mg
                           300 mg

adverseReactions_original:
AVAPRO is contraindicated in patients who are hypersensitive to any component of this product.
                  Do not coadminister aliskiren with AVAPRO in patients with diabetes.
